articles.author: Sinéad Carew, Shristi A
articles.description: The S&P 500 and the Dow fell while the Nasdaq clung to a tiny gain in choppy trade on Tuesday, pressured by rising Treasury yields and oil prices as investors assessed prospects for the Federal Reserve's interest rate path.
articles.title: Wall St slips as Treasury yields rise, oil prices boost energy sector

articles.author: Natalie Grover
articles.description: Oil prices jumped about 2% on Tuesday after Saudi Arabia and Russia announced a fresh extension to their voluntary supply cuts, stretching a combined 1.3 million barrel per day (bpd) reduction for another three months through December.
articles.title: Oil jumps as Saudi Arabia and Russia extend supply cuts to end-2023

articles.author: Saeed Azhar, Ann Saphir
articles.description: U.S. lenders are holding onto large piles of cash as insurance against a slowing economy, continuing deposit outflows and looming tougher liquidity rules that could particularly impact mid-sized banks.
articles.title: Analysis: US banks hold $3.3 trillion cash amid banking crisis, slowdown worries

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: U.S. auto safety regulators said Tuesday that 52 million air bag inflators produced by auto suppliers ARC Automotive and Delphi Automotive need to be recalled because they may rupture and send dangerous metal fragments flying.
articles.title: US says 52 mln air bag inflators should be recalled over rupture threat

articles.author: Manya Saini
articles.description: SoftBank Group's (9984.T) Arm is seeking a valuation of more than $52 billion in its initial public offering, the chip designer said on Tuesday as it begins marketing for the biggest U.S. stock market flotation of the year.
articles.title: SoftBank's Arm aims for over $52 bln valuation in biggest US IPO of the year

articles.author: Isla Binnie, Bianca Flowers
articles.description: High costs and environmental opposition have prevented the construction of blast furnaces at steel mills in the United States since 1980. Cleveland-Cliffs Inc (CLF.N) CEO Lourenco Goncalves is on a mission to snap up all that are left.
articles.title: Focus: Inside Cleveland-Cliffs' bid to keep U.S. blast furnaces smelting

articles.author: Curtis Williams, Marianna Parraga
articles.description: Shell (SHEL.L) and Trinidad and Tobago's National Gas Company (NGC) are close to agreeing to credit Venezuela's state-run oil firm for its $1 billion investment in a gas field the three want to jointly develop, four people close to the discussions said.
articles.title: Exclusive: Shell, Trinidad weigh Venezuela's natural gas investment demands

articles.author: Special Reports
articles.description: Excerpts from 17 phone calls placed in early July by Russian soldiers fighting in Ukraine - and intercepted by Ukrainian intelligence services - show them complaining about poor equipment and heavy losses.
articles.title: Ukrainian intercepts show Russian soldiers’ anger at losses, disarray

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Cuba has uncovered a human trafficking ring that has coerced its citizens to fight for Russia in the war in Ukraine, its foreign ministry said on Monday, adding that Cuban authorities were working to "neutralize and dismantle" the network.
articles.title: Cuba uncovers human trafficking of Cubans to fight for Russia in Ukraine

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Around 6 billion tons of marine sand is being dug up each year in a growing practice that a U.N. agency said is unsustainable and can wipe out local marine life irreversibly.
articles.title: Sand dredging is 'sterilising' ocean floor, UN warns
